etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin (febris) quartana, based on Latin quartus ‘fourth’ (because, by inclusive reckoning, the fever recurs every fourth day)

definitions: denoting a mild form of malaria causing a fever that recurs every third day.

notes.text: Quartan malaria (or quartan ague) is caused by infection with Plasmodium malariae. Compare with tertian

shortDefinitions: denoting mild form of malaria causing fever that recurs every third day
